intro: Gnaphalium capillaceum, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, hairy leaves and fluffy, yellowish flower heads are adapted to withstand coastal conditions. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize dunes.
